dialogues.text: I know: You/’re uptight about taking on the formidable Widow Evans... piece of work ... But think of the perks: Park Avenue condos, Bavarian cars, vacations in Virgin Gorda ... And I figured you’d end up with an ex-hippie social worker. Isaac ignores O’Brien, turns to Alan.

dialogues.text: Have you ever had a patient with a phony pathology?

dialogues.text: I @gon’t want to know anything about it. Just make it right somehow.

dialogues.text: (terrified, babbles) You dragged us into this -- you gotta fix it, Isaac -- O’Brien glares at Alan again. When he turns back, Isaac h sped into a full-out sprint, leaving his friends behind . cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hil What‘s going on? Isaac waits for the orderly to exit. Heather takes a step forward, steals a quick kiss. Then pulls away, when Isaac doesn’t kiss back. Off her questioning look:

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: When you married Jimmy were you already planning to kill him? or did the plan just sort of evolve?

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: Isaac, please -- this is crazy --

dialogues.text: Crazy maybe but clever too, sending me your sister -- how concerned and compassionate ... and I fell for it. Tf believed every word. I thought -- finally -- something real. But all along you were just sucking me in -- Heather’s tone is simultaneously pleading and piercing:  86.

The bond a patient develops with the doctor who listens to her, analyzes her, counsels her ... it’s such a powerful force, even a phony patient will start to feel something you might call "love". (then) Diana told me everything. How you came to court, watched me testify ... Auditioning me for the part ... Heather sinks onto the nearest chair. Weakly:

dialogues.text: But she thinks she does. You let her lie on my Couch week after week free~- associating, fantasizing, fabricating ... Well, that gives a psychiatrist some insight. And a degree of control. When Heather looks up we see that she is crying.

dialogues.text: Get out of here. I never want to see you again. Isaac lights a Camel. He’s riffing, on anxiety overdrive,

See, it'll be quite awhile before you get out -- once you’re stuck in a maximum security psychiatric hospital, your civil rights sort of ... evaporate. The sister’s your patient and you're banging the accused. And I don’t have a fucking murder weapon. He glowers at Isaac. Who tentatively steps around him.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC

dialogues.text: What? Tell me -- is deeply sorry, but:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: That was the handle of a dumbbell.  94. The grounds around Isaac seem to blur a bit, and almost s to spin.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER

dialogues.text: -- What? INTERCUT HEATHER, in:

dialogues.speaker: DA. 1

dialogues.speaker: D.A. 1
dialogues.text: In the meantime, why don’t we begin.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I should have a lawyer present, but my lawyer is his best friend. Again, a nod at Isaac. Trying to conceal her irritation:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I tried to replace him but the Judge won't let me ~- because I was recently found to be temporarily insane -- so I have to defend myself on my own.

dialogues.speaker: D.A. 2
dialogues.text: (gently) Don’t worry, Ms. Evans. We’1ll listen carefully and impartially to anything you want to tell us. Heather's looks says: I wish I could believe that.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: My sister is one of his patients. He and I met a few times, to discuss family matters. And in the course of that, we ... we began an affair. Isaac shakes out a cigarette. Lights it. Nervously puffs.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: When Isaac first suggested killing my husband, I thought he was joking. But he knew I suffered from pathological intoxication and he became obsessed, insisting we had the makings of ... She pauses. It’s tough to articulate such an alien concep

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: -.. the "perfect murder".  97. The D.A.‘s make copious notes. Isaac sits, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: One night Isaac followed me home. He was excited, agitated. I begged him to leave but he came upstairs and ... he did it. He hit Jimmy. Isaac hit Jimmy, with a dumbbell. The conference room door opens. Diana is led in by a seco Orderly, who remains in the room. Diana carries a briefca Isaac anxiously eyes it.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I was horrified ... I think Isaac was too. He just sort of ran out of the apartment, and then he called, Tf don’t know, five minutes later from a bar, I think. Said I’d better tell the police I’d done it... after sipping Nyquil. The D.A.’s gravely stare at Isaac ~~ who gazes at the flo drops his cigarette, grinds it out.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I =~ did as I was told. She momentarily cracks. Starts to softly cry.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: But I was thinking clearly enough to hide the dumbbell Isaac used. I know that was wrong -- concealing evidence ++ but I’ve been so scared ... It’s too much for her -- she "breaks down". The D.A.’s uncomfortably shift. Isaac puffs. Diana digs into her purse and finds a tissue for her sister. Heather pulls herself together. Between sniffles:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I asked Diana to bring this briefcase today. She doesn’t know what’s inside. A warm sisterly smile.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sweetie ... Let them have it. Diana dutifully hands the briefcase to the D.A.’s. Isaac watches, tensing as D.A. 2 snaps it open. Pulls out --  98. ~~ a sheaf of sketchbook paper. Heather looks confused. She grabs for the briefcase. But there is nothing else inside.

dialogues.text: Covered with demented scrawls in poster paint. As the D.A leaf through them we note the phrase "Dr. Barr must die", the name "Isaac" scribbled above the word "Satan", the tw connected with arrows. This was Bantar Man’s gift to Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Heather angrily grabs at the papers. Then turns on Diana.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: -- Where’s the dumbbell? Her tone is harsh -~ like the voice she’d used in Lutece. Diana cringes.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Where did you get these? From him? Shooting Isaac a lethal look. Then, to the D.A.‘s:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: He’s controlling her. He forced her to substitute these paintings. She whirls, again, on Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: They’re from the planet Bantar, aren’t they? — The D.A.’s trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: How did you get her to bring them, Isaac? You’re fucking her, aren’t you? Isaac turns away. Diana, mortified, is staring out a wind

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Answer, you bastard! She flies out of her chair, at Isaac. The Ordleries grab restrain her. Urgently petitioning the deadpan D.A.’s:  99.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: They’re in this together. Do you see? They’re trying to frame me!

dialogues.speaker: D.A. 2
dialogues.text: Of course, Ms. Evans. D.A. 1 snaps open his own briefcase. Inside are medicatio and syringes. Heather’s eyes widen as an Orderly yanks up her sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: ~~ What? And now she realizes:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You’re doctors. As "D.A. 1" -- actually Doctor 1 -~ sinks in the syringe:

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 2
dialogues.text: You know we’re doctors ... You're just a little confused right now. Explaining, in infuriatingly gentle tones:

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 1
dialogues.text: I’m with the Forensic Review Committee.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 2
dialogues.text: I consult with your late husband's insurance company. Heather starts flailing.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You tricked me. All of you --

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 2
dialogues.text: You're very upset, Ms. Evans. Confirming this, as she shouts to no one in particular:

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC

dialogues.speaker: TSAAC

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sonovobitch bastard -~ The Orderlies cart her away. We HEAR the muffled sounds o SCREAMING; they FADE as she’s dragged farther down the ha Diana is standing, mute and expressionless, in a far corn Stunned, the two Doctors approach Isaac. Quietly:

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 1
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 2
dialogues.text: When you came in the other day with your diagnosis, we were -- well, we were skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 2
dialogues.text: There was no indication of psychosis, no prior history. But ...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 1
dialogues.text: She’s worse than you described her. Talk about paranoid ... Who did she think we were? District Attorneys? Isaac shakes his head -- he’s mystified.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Maybe the anxiety of killing her husband -- plus the repeated insults of alcohol ~~ have produced a stress~ related organic psychosis. (shrugs) I wouldn't be surprised if there was further deterioration.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR 1
dialogues.text: We'll want her reviewed in six months. You’re familiar with the case, Dr. Barr. You should be on the evaluation team.  101.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I’ll try to find the time. But you know, these cases can drag on... patients remain committed for years. The Doctors nod -~ they know. They know. cut To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac and Diana. The aftermath: She’s sobbing, remorseful Isaac pats her knee, attempting to soothe her.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: It’s okay ... Now the Cabbie does a typically wild maneuver -- veering across four lanes -- and Diana’s head is whipped around. Isaac unloads all his tension on the Cabbie:

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Could you drive sanely please? We/’d like to get there alive. The Cabbie grudgingly slows and Isaac turns back to Diana

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You did the right thing. The only thing ...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: -.. Did I? She wears a doubtful look. Begging for more encouragement

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Now that you’re free of her you can finally begin to be ... who you are. The faint trace of a hopeful smile crosses Diana’s lips.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You’1l see. The caterpillar is going to become a butterfly, Diana. Then he adds, as casually as he can:

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Meantime, after all that’s happened, we should keep our distance for awhile. Diana’s smile flickers, uncertain.  102.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: So no one draws a conclusion that might be dangerous to us both. Diana nods: she sees his point.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: So all I need from you is the dumbbell back. Then well stay clear of each other -~- only for as long as necessary, of course. A long beat. Then Diana pulls a Kleenex from her pocketbo and dries her eyes. Smiles again, rather coyly.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Can I fix you some tea? Camomile? Mint?

dialogues.speaker: TSAAC
dialogues.text: I shouldn’t stay, Diana. I just --

Still standing by the door -~- ready to make a fast getaw Isaac watches as she moves to her bedroom closet, opens i Massive clutter. Scowls.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hmm. Isaac steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: -~ What? Diana snaps her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I know. I hid it somewhere better. After that detective ...

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Huggins?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (nods) After he started calling. And then he came by. Poked around.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ -~

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: He wants it real bad. So I hid it ... A beat, as she concentrates. Then it comes back to her:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: ... under the mattress. Diana crosses to her bed, leans down, feels under it, fro Isaac crosses. Joins her. Feels, too. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Shit. She straightens up. Squints at the bed. And remembers:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I couldn’t sleep with it there. She takes in a breath. Surveys her apartment. Exhales.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: The dumbbell, the dumbbell ...  104. She starts moving around, throwing stuff off her nightsta flinging things in the air ...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It’s here somewhere I know it’s here -~

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0S)

dialogues.text: Oh the safety’s always on -~ BLAM! As the thing discharges, a bullet ZIPPING past Isaa ear and EXPLODING a lamp.

dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Diana pauses to look at the gun, then at Isaac, to marvel

dialogues.speaker: DIANA

She brushes aside empty cereal boxes, discarded shoes ... Isaac now wears a small, ironic smile. Diana, feet firmly planted in the middle of the maelstrom throws up her arms, extravagantly befuddled.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I just don’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: TSAAC
dialogues.text: ... Right.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I’m so embarrassed ... I mean I know it’1ll turn up one day ... Then, an idea:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Y'know, maybe ... in the course of my therapy ... Maybe you’il help me break through my defenses and remember where I put the damn thing. Isaac just nods. He’s almost amused.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So. I guess this butterfly will be seeing you Tuesday. At the regular time ..?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: See you then, Diana. He starts to turn, to open the door, but:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
